result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Anthony Masciola

records.addlTxt: Notice of hearing for the final pretrial and jury trial printed with mailing address of Mr. Masciola to the county jail.  He has been released so the JA mailed the notices to Mr. Masciola at the address listed on the case.
Final pre-trial on January 20, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial on February 7, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Atty Curran has not received the Information but State advises the charges mirror the Complaint.  Atty Curran waives reading and stands mute.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Court enters Not Guilty Plea.  Matter reset.

11:07 AM Defendant Michael Anthony Masciola in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael C. Curran in court for Michael Anthony Masciola.  Attorney Natalia J Gess in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court starts to go through waiver of prelim form.  Recess at 11:09 AM.  Back on the record at 11:10 AM.  DE is satisfied that the medications he is taking are not affecting his ability to waive the prelim freely, knowingly and voluntary.  Atty Curran agrees.  Court accepts the waiver and finds same to be free, knowing and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.
